questions.question_text:
A data engineer needs to apply custom logic to string column city in table stores for a specific use case. In order to apply this custom logic at scale, the data engineer wants to create a SQL user-defined function (UDF).

Which of the following code blocks creates this SQL UDF?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It's "A". Google SQL Syntax to create a function and you'll find your answer with 100% of peace of mind. "D" doesn't make sense

Selected Answer: A
there is nothing called UDF while defining . Syntax is create Function <Function name>

Selected Answer: A
Vacuum with a date range =< 3 days because default is over 7 days

choices.A: The VACUUM command was run on the table
choices.D: The OPTIMIZE command was nun on the table
choices.C: The DELETE HISTORY command was run on the table
choices.B: The TIME TRAVEL command was run on the table

questions.question_text:
A data engineer has realized that they made a mistake when making a daily update to a table. They need to use Delta time travel to restore the table to a version that is 3 days old. However, when the data engineer attempts to time travel to the older version, they are unable to restore the data because the data files have been deleted.

Which of the following explains why the data files are no longer present?
Which of the following describes the relationship between Bronze tables and raw data?

choices.C: Bronze tables contain raw data with a schema applied.
choices.D: Bronze tables contain a less refined view of data than raw data.
choices.A: Bronze tables contain less data than raw data files.
choices.B: Bronze tables contain more truthful data than raw data.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C. Bronze tables contain raw data with a schema applied. Bronze tables are typically the first layer in a data pipeline and are used to store raw data in a structured format, making it easier to process and analyze.

Selected Answer: D
if review_period == 'True' is comparing the actual text 'True' not boolean

Selected Answer: D
In python, to compare two values, we use ==. Also, because review_period is true, no need to compare it to a value. "if review_period" is enough and "if review_period== 'True'" is wrong because we compare a boolean to a string.

Selected Answer: D
d is right answer

questions.question_text:
A data engineer only wants to execute the final block of a Python program if the Python variable day_of_week is equal to 1 and the Python variable review_period is True.

Which of the following control flow statements should the data engineer use to begin this conditionally executed code block?

comments.content:
Why not D?

target

Type: string

The name of a database for persisting pipeline output data. Configuring the target setting allows you to view and query the pipeline output data from the Databricks UI.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B. At least one notebook library to be executed. When creating a new Delta Live Tables pipeline, you need to specify at least one notebook library that contains the code to be executed as part of the pipeline.

choices.B: At least one notebook library to be executed
choices.D: A location of a target database for the written data
choices.C: A path to cloud storage location for the written data
